item.description:
Join us for the first official hike of winter. We will hike in below treeline to the base of the southern presidentials on the first day (December 21) and then summit Monroe, Ike, Pierce, and Jackson on our way out on the 22nd.

Since winter starts at 12:47 ET (17:47 UT) we will start our hike at 1pm in order to make it an official winter hike. I will withhold the exact itinerary of the hike until the saturday night before the trip as I want to have a chance to screen everyone on that saturday.



This hike will require the following gear:

Warm winter jacket, hat, and mittens/gloves
Thermal underwear
Waterproof jacket and pants (snowpants are fine)
3+ pairs of warm wool socks
warm, ankle-protecting boots
15 degree or colder Sleeping bag
Plenty of food and water
Headlamp with extra batteries
Spare warm clothes for emergencies

Depending on conditions you may need:

microspikes/stabilizers
snowshoes
poles

I will be bringing my stove and I have a tent which others can use if needed (I will be in my bivy sack which I highly recommend buying if possible). I also have emergency supplies and will cook friday dinner for everyone (probably pasta).

There is plenty of other gear which is useful to bring, but it is up to you if you want the extra weight. Having a pocket rocket would be very useful as you can melt snow to replenish your water. If you think I forgot anything in the above list please let me know.
item.how_to_find_us: This is an approximate address. I will include the exact address in my itinerary.
item.name: Winter Hike! Southern Presidentials Overnight
